title: Suspension/Banning
body:
Hi Riot Games,

I live in America which is a free Country, so fix your games suspension and banning rules or take your game out of America, sick of getting unnecessary bans and they are not even reviewed by Riot, but by other players which is absolutely absurd. Fix this or you will lose all of your player base and have many future problems.

Thank You

replies.body:
The OP's issue has been resolved and there is nothing further to relay about this punishment. 

If you have any questions about this moderation, feel free to reach out to us in the [Boards Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification) or [Discuss the Boards](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation).

1. If you think your suspension was unnecessary, please feel free to post your chat logs and prove it.

2. Private companies have every right to control their customer base - including removing them from the "premises" if they so choose.

3. Bans are not reviewed by players, bans are issued by Riot through the automated Instant Feedback System. If you want a human review, you're free to contact support.

4. People have been saying League would lose its player base for years now. It hasn't happened.

1. -No need to prove anything to riot games, just show it? just stop playing a game that is not fair in its disciplinary action.

2. - Unfortunately its not publicly traded, would have turned out to be a way better company.. Lost so much potential that it could of had.

3. -Wow they did make a change? Even worse a bot cannot judge emotion, nor make a decision to punish a human, hence why we dont have supercomputers in court. Ever heard of the turing test?. Such uneducated Advisors in this game..

4. - It hasn't happened because they keep making new accounts because the game is actually a fun game, but it will eventually wear out buddy don't worry.

1. I think that's the goal - you either reform and behave or you leave.

2. Really no response here? A company being publicly traded doesn't make it good or not. There are many video game companies that are publicly traded - all of which still have smaller player bases than League does.

3. Emotion doesn't matter. Action does. You're free to ask for a human to review it and revert the punishment if it was unwarranted. The IFS is actually more accurate and consistent than Riot.

4. Actually, statistics show that most permanently banned players never return on a new account. The player base is, for the most part, organic - i.e. one account = one player. *for the most part*.

1. Right, and I have already stated if you read correctly that players will be leaving eventually, also Advisor's do not get access to riot's player intake statistics of player volume sorry, but good try buddy.
2. If this company was publicly traded, the volume of people that are against the banning punishment would outweigh those who want to keep it. Don't think you understand what publicly traded means, do some research.
3. Emotion doesn't matter? So your saying there is no emotion in writing? Go tell that to book writers haha thats the stupidest thing i have ever heard. Please edit ur response.
4. What statistics? Ones you dont have access to? Please provide link. This company is private not public again that information is not released unless riot releases it. sorry buddy. stop quoting statistics you dont have access to. thx.

1. People have supposedly been "eventually" leaving for over 5 years now. Forgive me if I don't see any reason that they should suddenly start leaving now would change.

2. In fact, the punishment system is based on Tribunal, in which most cases ended with over 80-90% player participation either for punish or pardon. There were very few "edge" cases. Further, less than 20% of players ever get punished. Lastly, publicly traded does not mean a company must follow what the "majority" wants. It only means that the stock owners have some input as to directors/company boards.

3. Your emotions do not excuse toxic behavior.

4. They *have* released it. I would dig up the links but you obviously aren't going to believe them even if I do so, so I won't waste my time.

1. Man you love to pull these statistics you seem to have access to out of thin air. Forgive me but you have access to nothing, therefore you should stop saying people are not leaving because you cannot see if they are are not.

The Bible says to forgive your neighbor 77 times not 4 and your permanently dead or banned. What kind of reasoning is that? We would all be dead with all of the sins and mistakes we make.

> Ever heard of the turing test?

What does the Turing Test have to do with this? It's just a test made to judge the capacity of a computer intelligence to imitate and be indiscernible from human intelligence. The Turing Test has nothing to do with an automated system designed to review and punish players for negative or abusive chat.

Remember, we're talking about a punishment system here, not a synthetic life.

Besides, the Turing Test has been criticised as being pretty shitty as a way to judge artificial intelligence solely for the fact that the only purpose of it is to see whether or not a computer intelligence can look arguably like a human.

So, since we're talking about a system that has no need or design to deal with or appear human to external individuals...Bringing up the Turing Test is pretty pointless.
